52f91910-0387-4c4a-9dcd-2bdd0f777134: A Hellknight who successfully uses the {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} to cause a creature within 10 feet to become {g|ConditionShaken}shaken{/g} can instead cause that creature to become {g|ConditionFrightened}frightened{/g}.
c2d010bc-e585-4527-b574-4047b5bc4b9c: A character must choose one Hellknight order to join at 1st level. The choice of order determines what disciplines the character gains later access to. If a character takes a level in the armiger class, they must choose an order as well, but they don't gain any benefits from it until they gain levels in the Hellknight or Hellknight signifer class.
a8cbed6b-476a-4640-8d06-99e6108ce150: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}, a Hellknight increases his base {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} by 10 feet and gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. If the Hellknight is mounted, these bonuses also apply to his mount.
c72fff3b-a8c5-4137-a3ba-8e53a3872dd7: As long as he wears armor, a 9th-level Hellknight gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion checks{/g}. In addition, while wearing the armor, he gains {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} to fire 30, resistance to acid 10, and resistance to cold 10.
db4019d5-f539-4f35-8db4-29c2af6a31aa: At 10th level, a Hellknight can grant a weapon he wields one of the following {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g}: axiomatic, flaming burst, or unholy. Additionally, Hellknight becomes {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immune{/g} to fire while wearing armor.
ee1de182-21b2-4231-b095-9fbddf1eb66e: At 1st level you gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:CMB}CMB{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}. This bonus increases by +1 at 5th and 9th level.
d30098a1-1e33-4bff-9172-7f54b20089f7: At 1st level you gain an aura which you can use 3 times per day. It lasts 1 minute and grants all allies in a 30-foot radius a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}chaotic{/g} enemies. This bonus increases by +1 at 5th and 9th level.
cb8795de-4052-4e20-9cb3-995a292dc984:
At 1st level, a hellknight selects a creature type from the ranger favored enemies list. He gets a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against them.
At 5th level and 9th level this bonus increases by additional +2.
If the hellknight chooses humanoids or outsiders as a favored enemy, he must also choose an associated subtype, as indicated on the table below. If a specific creature falls into more than one category of favored enemy, the ranger's bonuses do not stack; he simply uses whichever bonus is higher.
1b781fce-5adb-4c5b-a7f2-e3ccdd49bb48: At 1st level, whenever you receive {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Fast_Healing}fast healing{/g} 5 for the number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to your level in this prestige class. At 5th level you gain fast healing 10 and at 9th level you gain fast healing 15 instead.
fee66f46-c53b-4b1a-a1a7-86b10d25c8df: At 2nd level, a Hellknight gains armor training, as the fighter ability of the same name. If the Hellknight already has this ability, its bonuses instead increase by 1. At 5th level and 8th level, the bonuses provided by armor training increase by an additional 1.
92fe5ee1-137f-442c-80ce-f389016a0d64: At 3rd level, a Hellknight gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saves{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with any one of the following subschools or {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Descriptor}descriptors{/g}: charm, compulsion, fear. At 6th level, the Hellknight chooses another subschool or descriptor from the list and gains a +2 bonus on his Will save against spells of that type, and the bonus provided by his first selection increases to +4. At 9th level, he chooses from the list again, and both previous selections increase by +2, so that he has a +6, a +4, and a +2 bonus, respectively, against spells of three different groups.
5695a58f-4de3-4ed1-a5a2-0c08a9fe6c58: At 3rd level, a Hellknight gains access to his first discipline. At 6th level, the Hellknight gains a second discipline. At 9th level, the Hellknight gains his third discipline. When applicable, the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} to resist a discipline's effect is equal to DC 10 + the Hellknight's level + his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. The Hellknight can use any one discipline a number of times per day equal to the total number of disciplines he has access to, so at 3rd level he can use his discipline once per day. At 6th level, he can use both disciplines twice per day each. At 9th level, he can use all three of his disciplines three times per day.
77fd9904-e90a-4f85-9523-fd4338adefb7: At 7th level, a Hellknight's {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} are treated as being {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}lawful{/g} for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}.
3b573975-7ed8-4ad8-b4b8-ac6b1ffe5d9d:
Hellknights of the Chain value social order and responsibility, seeking to root out anarchists and fugitives. They have reputations as relentless hunters who drag lawbreakers away in chains. These Hellknights keep meticulous count of the number of criminals they've brought to justice; they never abandon the pursuit of a fugitive, and they believe everyone has a specific, crucial role to play in society.
At 1st level you gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:CMB}CMB{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}. This bonus increases by +1 at 5th and 9th level.
9a387902-f498-4f1a-8d1f-be32c8927dca:
Hellknights of the Order of the Pyre seek to combat outlandish faiths and beliefs, preventing them from gaining purchase in the Inner Sea region. They are cult hunters first and foremost, but also fight to repress other philosophies they deem dangerous. These Hellknights hate and vocally condemn cultists, priests of rare religions, and followers of mystical orders.
At 1st level, whenever you receive {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Fast_Healing}fast healing{/g} 5 for the number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to your level in this prestige class. At 5th level you gain fast healing 10 and at 9th level you gain fast healing 15 instead.
4021fdd1-9f0f-473e-970e-bc3a1ceb0a7e:
Hellknights of the Scourge seek out corruption within order and laws not fit for the lawful. They question and seek to determine the difference between what is legal and what is for the greater good — owing allegiance to no one nation or ruler. Their quests for order often take them places that other Hellknights cannot tread, both physically and philosophically. As a result, their commitment to the Measure and the Chain must be beyond reproach.
Whenever you land a killing blow, all enemies in a 15-foot radius suffer a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throws{/g} for 3 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}. This penalty increases to -3 at 5th and -4 at 9th level.
45d106f3-42ce-4885-8e0d-486f46e9dc5d: Not all who start as novice armigers have what it takes to become a full-fledged Hellknight, but those who do receive a wide array of abilities as they grow more powerful. While the individual powers and focus of a particular Hellknight vary according to his order, all Hellknights are universally feared and respected in regions where they maintain a presence. Most Hellknights are lawful neutral and proudly avoid being "tainted" by distractions such as good or evil, but some who rise in power shift toward tyrannical and cruel natures.
4ade6643-59c0-4880-a396-8b318a161bec:
Once per day, a Hellknight can call out to the powers of law to aid him in his struggle against chaos. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, the Hellknight chooses one target within sight to smite. If this target is chaotic, the Hellknight adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus (if any) to his {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and adds twice his Hellknight level to all {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made against the target of his smite. Smite chaos attacks automatically bypass any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} the creature might possess. In addition, while smite chaos is in effect, the Hellknight gains a deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to his Charisma modifier (if any) to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against attacks made by the target of the smite.
If the Hellknight targets a creature that is not chaotic, the smite is wasted with no effect.
The smite chaos lasts until the target dies or the Hellknight selects a new target. At 4th level, and at every three levels thereafter, the Hellknight may smite chaos one additional time per day.
03325733-396a-43cf-976c-47483c7abbdb:
Order of the Gate Hellknights seek to curb and prevent lawlessness through magic and manipulation. They have reputations as mysterious, emotionless, and sometimes cruel magic-users. Many are convinced that the Order of the Gate's Hellknights are spying on them or already know their secrets. Sometimes this fear is true, as the order's members prefer preventing crime to punishing it and often use manipulation, information-gathering, and spying to further their agenda.
While a Hellknight of the Gate wears armor, he reduces the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g} by 5% at 1st level, 10% at 5th and 20% at 9th level.
7bf87c24-696e-4e72-aa1a-1f18724ac0e9:
Order of the Godclaw Hellknights enforce law with a crusader's zeal, going where they're needed most in the fight against the forces of chaos. They know no bounds or borders in the quest for absolute order. To Hellknights of the Godclaw, the cause of order is a holy mandate for which they will travel far to battle chaos in lands that know little of civilization. To others, these Hellknights' faith is likely inexplicable — some believe the members of the order are experts in all five individual faiths or even that they are heretics.
At 1st level you gain an aura which you can use 3 times per day. It lasts 1 minute and grants all allies in a 30-foot radius a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against chaotic enemies. This bonus increases by +1 at 5th and 9th level.
fba9bfe9-dc32-4477-bca2-2d1cda4bb072:
Order of the Nail Hellknights idealize civilized societies and seek to unite all people in advancing that cultural baseline. In fact, the Order of the Nail's members preach that anyone who doesn't embrace their own culture is a criminal and heathen who must be destroyed. The order's members idealize the lifestyles and challenges of frontier settlers, no matter the displacement, indignation, or cruelty they might visit on those who were there before.
At 1st level, a hellknight selects a creature type from the ranger favored enemies list. He gets a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against them.
At 5th level and 9th level this bonus increases by additional +2.
6973c803-a05b-4b03-bf3f-a8aaa9ff3845:
Order of the Rack Hellknights hate wastefulness of both thought and deed. They crush pointless dreams, end rebellions, and trample frivolous or dangerous inventions. They also closely observe individuals, seeking hints of destructive ambitions and wasteful vices, and are skilled at destroying seditious writing and strange inventions.
Three times per day as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} you can target a single creature. That creature must pass a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + level in this prestige class + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}) or become unable to cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} in this prestige class. At 5th and 9th levels you gain one additional use of this ability. The same effect occurs whenever you confirm a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}.
4e693d65-100b-4932-b15b-8ffee3c33f44: The Hellknight can make a {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to cause a creature to suffer incredible pain. The creature touched takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} + the Hellknight's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier, and must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} or become {g|ConditionStaggered}staggered{/g} for 1d4 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}.
fa9a40ab-988c-4d40-8c85-b7d65f06af53: The Hellknight can summon a creature to aid him in battle, as if using a summon monster {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, save that the summoned creature lingers for 1 hour before vanishing. A Hellknight can summon a wolf. A 9th-level Hellknight can summon a hell hound.
01db47e0-19c3-48e8-89d1-c29361b63540: The Hellknight can use {g|SpellsGreaterCommand}greater command{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g}, using her {g|Encyclopedia:Character_Level}character level{/g} as her {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
d2d5eb48-32f1-425a-a3c0-35e11eb482c5: This ability allows the Hellknight to select one of the following domains: Artifice, Glory, Knowledge, Law, Magic, Nobility, Protection, Rune, Strength, Travel, or War. The Hellknight gains the granted powers of that domain, treating his Hellknight levels as cleric levels to determine what domain abilities he has access to.
078dadfd-dd4a-4dcd-9af3-ecd61e31c9a4: Three times per day as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} you can target a single creature. That creature must pass a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + level in this prestige class + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}) or become unable to cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} in this prestige class. At 5th and 9th levels you gain one additional use of this ability. The same effect occurs whenever you score a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}.
15fd3967-ce55-4091-8950-865173722dfc: When the Hellknight uses smite chaos on a creature, he can impede its mobility. The creature can negate this effect with a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}; otherwise, it is affected as if by {g|SpellsSlow}slow{/g} for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}.
f0d95349-dbf9-429b-8f25-1cfc4147d6ee: When the Hellknight uses smite chaos on a creature, he can strike the creature mute for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} unless it succeeds at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}. A mute creature cannot speak or cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with verbal components.
2ec00beb-d93b-4548-a8b6-d3900735b92b: Whenever you land a killing blow, all enemies in a 15-foot radius suffer a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throws{/g} for 3 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}. This penalty increases to -3 at 5th and -4 at 9th level.
e3dc1271-5df9-4c14-b02a-3803d5a075d1: While a Hellknight of the Gate wears armor, he reduces the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g} by 5% at 1st level, 10% at 5th and 20% at 9th level.
